title: Brian Ahern (footballer)
text:
Brian Ahern (born 15 November 1952 in <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>), is a Scottish former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Ahern is best known for his time at <a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a>, where he holds the current record for most league appearances in the history of the club, at 420 appearances. He made 504 appearances in all competitions. Ahern was also the <a href="captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a> during the latter stages of his Clyde career, and he captained the side to the <a href="Scottish%20Second%20Division">Scottish Second Division</a> trophy during their <a href="centenary">centenary</a> year.
He was the solitary Clyde player selected for a <a href="Glasgow%20Football%20Association%23Glasgow%20Vs%20Sheffield">Glasgow Select XI</a> against the <a href="Football%20League%20XI">Football League XI</a> to mark the <a href="Silver%20Jubilee">Silver Jubilee</a> in 1977, but was an unused substitute. Ahern was picked for the <a href="Scotland%20national%20semi-professional%20football%20team">Scotland</a> semi professional team in 1981.
